General ML Smell Detector

class ml_code_smell_detector.detectors.ml_detector.ML_SmellDetector[source]

Bases: object

A detector for identifying common code smells in machine learning code.

This class analyzes Python source code to detect potential issues and anti-patterns commonly found in machine learning projects, such as data leakage, improper feature scaling, missing cross-validation, and more.

add_smell(smell, node, file_path)[source]

Add a detected code smell to the collection.

Parameters:

  • smell (str) – Description of the detected smell

  • node (NodeNG) – The AST node where the smell was detected

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file containing the smell

detect_smells(file_path)[source]

Analyze a Python file for ML-related code smells.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – Path to the Python file to analyze

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing detected smell information

Return type:

List[Dict[str, Any]]

is_package_used(node, package)[source]

Check if a specific package is imported in the module.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • package (str) – Name of the package to check for

Returns:

True if the package is imported, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

visit_module(node, file_path)[source]

Run all smell detection checks on a module.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_imports(node, file_path)[source]

Track imports used in the module for later analysis.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_data_leakage(node, file_path)[source]

Detect potential data leakage from preprocessing before train-test split.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_magic_numbers(node, file_path)[source]

Detect magic numbers in ML-related code.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_feature_scaling(node, file_path)[source]

Detect inconsistent feature scaling methods across the codebase.

Looks for multiple different scaling methods (StandardScaler, MinMaxScaler, etc.) being used, which could lead to inconsistent results.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_cross_validation(node, file_path)[source]

Check if cross-validation is properly implemented in model training.

Detects if common cross-validation methods (KFold, cross_val_score, etc.) are missing in model training code.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_imbalanced_dataset(node, file_path)[source]

Check if imbalanced dataset handling techniques are used in classification tasks.

Looks for common techniques like SMOTE, class weights, or stratification when dealing with classification problems.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_feature_selection(node, file_path)[source]

Detect feature selection practices and validate their implementation.

Ensures feature selection is performed with proper validation strategy to avoid selection bias.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_metric_selection(node, file_path)[source]

Validate the choice of evaluation metrics for ML models.

Ensures appropriate metrics are used for classification and regression tasks, warning against using only basic metrics like accuracy.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_model_persistence(node, file_path)[source]

Check model saving practices and associated preprocessing steps.

Ensures models are saved with their preprocessing steps and proper versioning for reproducibility.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_reproducibility(node, file_path)[source]

Check if random seeds are properly set for reproducibility.

Ensures random seeds are set for all relevant libraries (numpy, random, framework-specific) in ML operations.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_data_loading(node, file_path)[source]

Analyze data loading practices for potential issues.

Checks for proper handling of large datasets, including batch processing and file size checks.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_unused_features(node, file_path)[source]

Detect potentially unused features or variables in ML code.

Identifies variables that are defined but not used, excluding common variable names and special prefixes.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_overfit_prone_practices(node, file_path)[source]

Detect practices that might lead to overfitting.

Checks feature engineering functions for proper train/test separation to avoid data leakage.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_error_handling(node, file_path)[source]

Check for proper error handling in critical ML operations.

Ensures try-except blocks or validation checks are present for data operations and model-related tasks.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_hardcoded_filepaths(node, file_path)[source]

Detect hardcoded file paths in the code.

Identifies hardcoded paths that should be moved to configuration files or environment variables, excluding common development paths.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_documentation(node, file_path)[source]

Check for proper documentation in ML-related code.

Ensures functions and classes have appropriate docstrings, especially for those with parameters or return values.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

generate_report()[source]

Generate a human-readable report of all detected smells.

Returns:

Formatted string containing the analysis report

Return type:

str

get_results()[source]

Get the analysis results in a structured format.

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing smell details and locations

Return type:

List[Dict[str, str]]
